Detailed Description

Base class for exceptions thrown by the histogrammign subsystem. (could be used for any other subsystem for that matter).

Int_t CException::ReasonCode (    )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a code which describes the reason for the exception . This is exception type specific and may be used to do detailed exception analysis and recovery. For example in the CErrnoException class, the errno at the time of instantiation of the object is returned. The default returns -1

Reimplemented in CTCPNoSuchHost, CErrnoException, CRangeError, CStreamIOError, and CTCLException.

Definition at line 407 of file CException.cpp.

const char * CException::ReasonText (    )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a const pointer to text which describes the reason the exception was thrown. This is exception type specific. The default action returns a pointer to the constant string: "Unspecified Exception"

Reimplemented in CDuplicateNameException, CDuplicateSingleton, CIncompatibleMonitor, CLinkFailedException, CNoSuchLinkException, CNoSuchObjectException, CTCPBadSocketState, CTCPConnectionFailed, CTCPConnectionLost, CTCPNoSuchHost, CTCPNoSuchService, CErrnoException, CRangeError, CStreamIOError, and CTCLException.

const char * CException::WasDoing (    )  const
 

Returns a const pointer to m_szAction. This is intended to describe the action which was occuring when the exception was thrown.
